events.message: The policyholder reported a car accident involving a collision with another vehicle at an intersection during rush hour.
The claim has been categorised under auto accident following the initial details provided regarding the vehicle collision.
An agent was assigned promptly to handle the auto accident claim to ensure quick and efficient processing.
Acknowledgment of the claim was sent to the customer confirming receipt and outlining the next steps in the claims process.
The customer was requested to submit photos of the damaged vehicle and the police report related to the collision.
Customer successfully submitted all requested documents including vehicle damage photos and official police report.
Investigation began to verify details of the accident and assess liability and extent of vehicle damages.
Investigation concluded with full assessment indicating the policyholder is not at fault in the collision.
A settlement amount covering vehicle repairs and rental car expenses was proposed to the customer.
Customer responded positively, expressing satisfaction with the proposed settlement and timely updates.
Claim was officially approved based on the investigation and customer's acceptance of the settlement proposal.
Payment for the approved settlement amount was issued directly to the customerâ€™s account without delay.
The claim file was officially closed after confirmation of receipt of settlement funds and customer satisfaction.
Case documents and records were archived according to regulatory requirements for future reference.
